articles.title: New Year greetings to Kim Jong Il from foreigners
articles.content:
New Year greetings to Kim Jong Il from foreigners 
    Pyongyang, January 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received floral baskets, gifts, congratulatory letters and new year cards from representatives of foreign embassies and international organizations here on the occasion of the New Year Juche 90 (2001).
 Those baskets, gifts, letters and cards were conveyed to officials concerned by diplomatic envoys of China, Russia, Cuba, Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam, Iran, Indonesia, India, Libya, Egypt, Palestine, Yugoslavia, Pakistan, Poland, Romania, Sweden, Yemen, Syria, Ethiopia and Nigeria and the resident coordinator of the United Nations and resident representative of the UNDP and the representative of the UNICEF.

Greetings to Sudanese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Sudanese President
    Pyongyang, January 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to President Omar Hassan Ahmad Al-Bashir on Saturday on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the Independence of Sudan.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, government and the people of Sudan on its Independence Day.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries will continue to develop on good terms, it sincerely wished the president and the people of Sudan big success in their efforts for defending the national sovereignty and achieving peace, stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Palestinian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Palestinian President
    Pyongyang, January 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Saturday sent a message of greetings to Yasser Arafat, President of the state of Palestine, Chairman of the executive committee of the Palestine Liberation Organization and head of the Palestine national authority, on the occasion of the 36th anniversary of the start of the Palestinian revolution.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and the friendly people of Palestine on this day.    
 Expressing the conviction that the just struggle of the Palestinian people to achieve comprehensive, fair and lasting peace and establish an independent state with Kuds as its capital city will be sure to win, it wished the president fresh success in his work.
